item.title: The Dunes Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Story of Mob Ties & Magnificent Demise
item.description:
From Desert Dreams to Financial Woes

The Dunes Hotel and Casino. Just the name conjures images of shimmering turquoise, lush landscaping, and a certain old-school Vegas glamour. Opening its doors on May 23, 1955, it marked the tenth resort to grace the Las Vegas Strip, a significant addition to what was quickly becoming a burgeoning entertainment destination. However, the early years werenâ€™t all sunshine and showgirls. The initial ownership group struggled, plagued by poor management and a downturn in tourism that hit the Strip hard. Within months, the Sands Corporation stepped in to manage the property, hoping to turn things around. They, too, failed to revitalize the Dunes, lasting only six months before relinquishing control.
